title: American_Top_40_2000_January_1st_Y2K
description:
"Hello again everybody, I'm Casey Kasem and today we want to welcome you to a very special show; our Y2K countdown of the forty days that changed music."


The first run of American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is from the second Casey era, and does not necessarily reflect opinions of the first Casey era.

In this countdown:

I tried to hit on the highlights of this three-hour special but I found myself just transcribing the entire show. One member of our senior faculty here at the RocketMan Conservatory described this broadcast thusly:

"The original air-date was January 1, 2000, and it came to be known as the 'Y2K' special. It is a compelling look into the news events of the rock and roll era, along with the music that served as background along the way. Casey Kasem delivered it with excellence."

Launch Command: "When Ready"

32: Rock Around The Clock - Bill Haley & His Comets
31: Maybelline - Chuck Berry
30: Heartbreak Hotel - Elvis Presley
29: That'll Be The Day - Buddy Holly & The Crickets
